anglr 0.4.8.9500
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Draw points in 3d

dot3d.Rd

Draw points with rgl from any mesh-alike object.

# S3 method for sf
dot3d(x, ...)

# S3 method for matrix
dot3d(x, ...)

# S3 method for BasicRaster
dot3d(x, ...)

# S3 method for sc
dot3d(x, ...)

# S3 method for SC
dot3d(x, ...)

# S3 method for SC0
dot3d(x, ...)

Arguments

x

sc, sp, sf, raster, trip, or any other model understood by anglr/silicate
...

Arguments passed on to rgl::as.mesh3d

Examples

dot3d(cad_tas)
dot3d(volcano, size = 10)
auto_3d(z = 14)
#> original axis lengths x,y,z:  524709.81,5250543.00,    193.75
#> applying 'aspect3d( 1,  1, 14)'


rgl::clear3d()
## from ?persp
y <- x <- seq(-10, 10, length= 80)
z <- outer(x, y,
     function(x, y) {
        r <- sqrt(x^2+y^2); 10 * sin(r)/r
        })
dot3d(z)
auto_3d()
#> original axis lengths x,y,z: 80.00000,80.00000,12.10155
#> applying 'aspect3d(1, 1, 1)'
dot3d(raster::raster(volcano), size = 10)
auto_3d(z = 14)
#> original axis lengths x,y,z:  80.0000, 80.0000,195.9049
#> applying 'aspect3d(1.00, 1.00, 5.72)'
# \donttest{
dot3d(silicate::SC(cad_tas))
auto_3d(z = 14)
#> original axis lengths x,y,z:  524529.8125,5250453.0000,    195.9049
#> applying 'aspect3d( 1,  1, 14)'
# }
